definition[0]: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc
example[0]: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
example[1]: They squandered the profits on expensive cars.
definition[1]: to spend money or use your time carelessly on things that are not useful
example[2]: The bank squandered $500 million playing the U.S. bond market.
example[3]: He squandered the companyâ€™s assets on such things as corporate aircraft and very large salaries.
